title: Best Cryptos to Buy Now? Analysts Rank SOL, LINK, and MUTM for 2025 ROI Potential
body: As market momentum picks up mid-2025, crypto analysts are starting to sharpen their outlooks‚Äînot just for short-term gains but for long-term return on investment. With Bitcoin testing new highs and liquidity entering the space again, experienced investors are looking beyond the top few names. Three cryptocurrencies consistently making analysts‚Äô shortlists for top investment picks are Solana (SOL), Chainlink (LINK), and Mutuum Finance (MUTM). All three bring something different to the table. While SOL and LINK have established histories, MUTM represents a new opportunity, currently in its presale phase and gaining traction for its practical DeFi use case. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at why these tokens are being positioned by analysts as some of the best cryptos to buy now. What Is Mutuum Finance (MUTM)? Mutuum Finance is a decentralized, non-custodial protocol under development that aims to bring flexibility and transparency to lending and borrowing. Built on Ethereum, the protocol is being designed to support both passive income for depositors and capital access for borrowers‚Äîwithout intermediaries. The platform plans to issue mtTokens when users deposit assets like ETH, BTC, or USDT. These mtTokens will represent their deposited amount and accumulate value based on real-time borrowing activity. Borrowers will be able to use their assets as collateral to access liquidity without selling, with the protocol supporting both mainstream and more volatile assets under separate borrowing conditions. The team behind Mutuum is preparing to roll out a beta version of the platform shortly after token launch, and the project has already attracted early interest from DeFi users and private investors alike. Solana (SOL) Solana is once again trending across trading platforms. With prices recently hovering near $137, the token saw a 40% surge on April 15, recovering from prior declines. Though still below its January peak of nearly $294, SOL is finding renewed support as institutional interest returns. One of the biggest catalysts came with the approval of Canada‚Äôs first spot Solana ETF, which went live on April 16. Analysts now project SOL could rise toward $252 by the end of 2025, as investor confidence rebuilds and developers continue building within the ecosystem. Chainlink (LINK) Chainlink has faced downward pressure through the first half of the year. Currently trading at around $12.25, LINK remains under its yearly high. Analysts, however, remain optimistic about its long-term potential. Predictions suggest that LINK may reach $15.13 in the short term, with long-range expectations extending toward $48‚Äì$100, depending on the pace of enterprise adoption and broader DeFi integration. Despite its recent pullback, Chainlink continues to play a critical role in enabling smart contract infrastructure across multiple blockchains. Why MUTM Is the One to Watch Right Now While SOL and LINK continue to recover and position themselves for a strong Q3, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is quietly gaining attention for its early-stage potential. Currently in its 4th presale phase, the token is available at $0.025, offering an accessible entry point for investors looking to get in before the protocol officially goes live. So far, the project has raised over $6.8 million and onboarded more than 8,300 on-chain holders, indicating strong early support. The presale progresses through set phases, with each stage bringing a price increase‚Äîthe next one scheduled to rise to $0.03. That means those joining now are still catching MUTM at its lowest valuation. Shortly after launch, Mutuum Finance is expected to see its token price surge to around $0.50‚Äì$0.70, according to multiple analysts tracking early-stage DeFi projects. From the current presale price of $0.025, that represents a potential short-term increase of 1,900% to 2,700%. This growth is largely attributed to the combination of platform rollout, growing holder base, and expected listings on major exchanges, all of which are likely to boost both visibility and liquidity. Looking further ahead, projections for year-end 2025 suggest that MUTM could reach up to $4, backed by the platform‚Äôs buy-and-distribute mechanism. This model allocates a portion of the protocol‚Äôs revenue to actively repurchase tokens from the open market and redistribute them to mtToken holders. This creates sustainable demand without relying on inflationary emissions‚Äîoffering both price strength and long-term participation benefits. A move from $0.025 to $4 reflects a 15,900% increase, positioning MUTM among the top contenders for high-ROI crypto investments this year. The platform is also undergoing a CertiK audit, one of the most trusted security verification processes in DeFi. This not only brings added credibility to the protocol but also reassures new investors that the team is focused on long-term integrity and transparency. Beyond development and audit preparation, the team has already launched a live dashboard, giving users a view into protocol progress, presale data, and roadmap updates. It‚Äôs a level of clarity not often found in new crypto coins‚Äîand a sign that Mutuum is prioritizing trust from day one. Solana and Chainlink remain compelling for their roles in infrastructure and scalability, with solid forecasts for the months ahead. But when it comes to ROI potential, Mutuum Finance is standing out for one major reason‚Äîit hasn‚Äôt launched yet, and everything is still on the table. With a product already in progress, a committed roadmap, and a presale structure designed for early growth, MUTM is quickly being recognized as one of the best cheap cryptos to buy now. Analysts say that once listings and platform functionality go live, demand could rise significantly‚Äîand so could the price. As Q3 approaches, the real winners might not be the ones making headlines today, but the ones laying the groundwork for sustainable use tomorrow. That‚Äôs exactly where Mutuum Finance fits in. title: This Bitcoin Bear Confirmation Is Yet To Appear, Glassnode Reveals
body: The on-chain analytics firm Glassnode has revealed in a report how this historical bear market confirmation is yet to appear for Bitcoin in the current cycle. Bitcoin Unrealized Loss Hasn‚Äôt Spiked For Long-Term Holders Yet In its latest weekly report, Glassnode has discussed about the trend in the Unrealized Loss for the two major Bitcoin cohorts. The ‚ÄúUnrealized Loss‚Äù is an on-chain indicator that measures the total amount of loss that the BTC addresses as a whole are carrying. The metric works by going through the transfer history of each coin in circulation to see what price it was last moved at. If this previous trading price is more than the current spot price for any token, then that particular token‚Äôs assumed to be holding a net loss. Related Reading: Bitcoin Realized Cap Sets New Record, But Momentum Fades The indicator takes the difference between the two prices to find the exact measure of this loss. It then adds up this value for all coins part of the circulating supply to find the network total. In the context of the current topic, the usual version of the Unrealized Loss isn‚Äôt the one of interest, but rather a new variant known as the Unrealized Loss per Percent Drawdown. As the analytics firm explains, As the market continues to contract, it‚Äôs reasonable to expect the absolute size of unrealized losses to grow. To account for this and normalize across drawdowns of varying magnitudes, we introduce a new variant of the metric:¬†Unrealized Loss per Percent Drawdown, which expresses losses held in BTC terms relative to the percentage decline from the all-time high. First, here is a chart that shows the trend in this Bitcoin indicator specifically for the short-term holders: ‚ÄúShort-term holders‚Äù (STHs) refer to the Bitcoin investors who purchased their coins within the past 155 days. BTC is currently trading under the levels that it was at during most of this window, so these holders would majorly be in a state of loss. The Unrealized Loss per Percent Drawdown showcases this trend, as its value has shot up recently. Interestingly, the indicator is already at a high-enough level to be comparable with values seen during the start of previous bear markets. While the STHs are in substantial losses, the same isn‚Äôt true for the other side of the market: the ‚Äúlong-term holders‚Äù (LTHs). These investors, who have been holding onto their coins since more than 155 days ago, are carrying no unrealized loss at all right now. In the past, the LTHs have generally seen their loss spike up during the transition to a bear market. As the report notes, Historically, substantial expansions in unrealized losses among long-term holders have often marked the confirmation of bear market conditions, albeit with a delay following the market peak. Related Reading: Bitcoin Sentiment Still Close To Extreme Fear‚ÄîGreen Sign For Recovery? So far, this signal hasn‚Äôt appeared for Bitcoin. Something to keep in mind, though, is the fact that the top buyers will soon promote into the LTHs. Once that happens, the loss among the group is probable to register an increase. BTC Price Bitcoin has seen a pause in the recovery rally as its price has taken to sideways movement around $85,000. Featured image from Dall-E, Glassnode.com, chart from TradingView.com
tags: Bitcoin News|bitcoin|Bitcoin bear|bitcoin bear market|Bitcoin Unrealized Loss|btc|BTCUSDT|glassnode

title: Decoding Crypto Fear: Index Creeps Up to 33, But Market Still Gripped by Fear
body: Are you feeling the pulse of the crypto market? It‚Äôs a rollercoaster, isn‚Äôt it? One day you‚Äôre soaring with excitement, the next you‚Äôre bracing for a dip. To navigate these waves, seasoned crypto enthusiasts often turn to market sentiment indicators. One such crucial tool is the Crypto Fear and Greed Index . Let‚Äôs dive into the latest reading: the index has inched up to 33, a three-point rise from yesterday. Sounds like good news, right? Well, hold your horses! Despite this slight improvement, the index is still firmly planted in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone. What does this mean for your crypto portfolio and the overall market? Let‚Äôs break it down. Understanding the Crypto Fear and Greed Index Think of the Crypto Fear and Greed Index as a sentiment compass for the cryptocurrency market. It‚Äôs not just a random number; it‚Äôs a weighted compilation of various market indicators, meticulously crafted by Alternative.me. This index helps us understand the overarching emotions driving the crypto market ‚Äì are investors feeling greedy, potentially leading to inflated prices, or fearful, possibly signaling a buying opportunity? The scale ranges from 0 to 100: 0-24: Extreme Fear ‚Äì This zone often indicates a potential bottom in the market, where investors are excessively worried, and prices might be undervalued. 25-49: Fear ‚Äì Still a bearish sentiment, suggesting caution among investors. Prices might be under pressure or consolidating. 50-74: Greed ‚Äì A bullish sentiment emerges as investors become optimistic. This can lead to price appreciation. 75-100: Extreme Greed ‚Äì This zone signals a potential market top or bubble territory. Euphoria reigns, and prices might be overvalued, prone to corrections. Currently sitting at 33, the index reflects a state of ‚ÄòFear‚Äô in the crypto market sentiment . While it‚Äôs a notch above ‚ÄòExtreme Fear‚Äô, it‚Äôs still far from neutral or greedy territory. This suggests that a significant portion of the market remains apprehensive about the immediate future of cryptocurrencies. What Factors Drive the Fear and Greed Index? The Crypto Fear and Greed Index isn‚Äôt based on guesswork. It‚Äôs a data-driven metric that analyzes six key factors, each contributing a specific weight to the final score. Understanding these components is crucial to interpreting the index effectively: Factor Weight Description Volatility 25% Measures the current and maximum drawdowns of Bitcoin, compared with the corresponding average values of the last 30 and 90 days. Unusually high volatility can contribute to fear. Market Momentum/Volume 25% Compares the current market momentum and trading volume to the last 30 and 90-day averages. High buying volume can indicate greed, while low volume during price drops can signal fear. Social Media Sentiment 15% Analyzes social media platforms for sentiment related to cryptocurrencies. Positive sentiment can indicate greed, while negative sentiment can reflect fear. Surveys 15% Periodically conducted crypto polls to gauge investor sentiment directly. These surveys provide a snapshot of how crypto traders and investors are feeling. Bitcoin Dominance 10% Measures Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance relative to the broader crypto market. Increased Bitcoin dominance can sometimes indicate a ‚Äòflight to safety‚Äô during fearful times. Google Trends 10% Analyzes Google Trends data for crypto-related search queries. Surges in searches like ‚ÄúBitcoin crash‚Äù can indicate fear, while increased searches for ‚Äúbuy Bitcoin‚Äù might suggest greed. By combining these diverse data points, the Crypto Fear and Greed Index provides a holistic view of market sentiment, moving beyond just price action. Why Does the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô Zone Persist Despite the Index Rise? It‚Äôs interesting that the index nudged upwards, yet remains in ‚ÄòFear‚Äô. This seemingly contradictory situation highlights the nuances of market analysis and sentiment interpretation. A three-point increase is indeed a move in the positive direction, suggesting a slight easing of bearishness. However, it‚Äôs crucial to remember: Small Increments in Sentiment: A three-point rise, while statistically significant, is relatively small in the grand scheme of the 0-100 scale. It might indicate a temporary reprieve rather than a fundamental shift in market psychology. Lagging Indicators: Sentiment indices often react to, rather than predict, market movements. The slight increase could be a delayed reaction to some positive price action or news from the previous day, which might not be sustained. Broader Economic Concerns: The overall global economic climate, including inflation, interest rate hikes, and geopolitical uncertainties, heavily influences crypto market sentiment . These macroeconomic factors can override short-term positive crypto-specific news, keeping fear levels elevated. Specific Crypto Events: Events within the crypto space itself, such as regulatory announcements, exchange hacks, or project-specific failures, can quickly trigger fear, offsetting any minor improvements in general sentiment. Therefore, while the slight increase in the Crypto Fear and Greed Index is a positive tick, it‚Äôs essential to view it within the context of the broader market landscape. The ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone persistence suggests underlying anxieties still dominate investor thinking. Actionable Insights: Navigating the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô Zone So, what should you do when the Crypto Fear and Greed Index signals ‚ÄòFear‚Äô? Here are some actionable insights for crypto investors: Exercise Caution, But Don‚Äôt Panic: ‚ÄòFear‚Äô doesn‚Äôt automatically mean a market crash is imminent. It simply indicates prevailing negative sentiment. Avoid impulsive selling based solely on fear. Review Your Portfolio: Periods of fear can be opportune times to reassess your crypto holdings. Are your investments still aligned with your long-term goals? Is your portfolio diversified enough to weather potential downturns? Look for Buying Opportunities (Carefully): As the adage goes, ‚Äúbe fearful when others are greedy, and greedy when others are fearful.‚Äù ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zones can present potential buying opportunities for fundamentally strong cryptocurrencies at discounted prices. However, thorough research is paramount. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): In a fearful market, DCA can be a prudent strategy. Instead of trying to time the bottom, DCA involves investing a fixed amount at regular intervals, averaging out your entry price over time. Stay Informed and Analyze: Don‚Äôt rely solely on the Fear and Greed Index. Stay updated on market news, technical analysis, and fundamental developments in the crypto space. Use the index as one tool in your broader market analysis toolkit. Remember, market sentiment is cyclical. Fear phases are often followed by periods of greed, and vice versa. Understanding and strategically navigating these cycles is key to long-term success in the crypto market. Conclusion: Cautious Optimism in a Fearful Market The Crypto Fear and Greed Index at 33, remaining in ‚ÄòFear‚Äô, paints a picture of cautious crypto market sentiment . While the slight uptick is a glimmer of positivity, it‚Äôs not yet a signal to throw caution to the wind. The market remains influenced by a complex interplay of factors, from macroeconomic uncertainties to crypto-specific events. For investors, this environment calls for a balanced approach: prudence, diligent research, and a long-term perspective. The ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone can be challenging, but it also presents opportunities for those who are prepared and informed. Keep a close eye on market indicators, stay adaptable, and remember that sentiment is always in flux in the dynamic world of cryptocurrencies. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Strategic Crypto Investment: Wintermute Ventures Bolsters Portfolio with Euler Finance
body: In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, strategic partnerships and investments are the lifeblood of innovation and growth. The latest buzz in the crypto sphere comes from market-making giant Wintermute, whose investment arm, Wintermute Ventures , has just announced a significant addition to its portfolio. Get ready to delve into the details of Wintermute Ventures‚Äô exciting new investment in Euler Finance, a move that signals confidence in the future of decentralized finance (DeFi) and highlights the strategic direction of one of crypto‚Äôs key players. Why Wintermute Ventures is Doubling Down on DeFi with Euler Finance For those in the crypto know, Wintermute Ventures isn‚Äôt just another name. It‚Äôs the investment arm of Wintermute, a leading global market maker in digital assets. Their decision to invest in Euler Finance isn‚Äôt a spur-of-the-moment choice; it‚Äôs a calculated move based on a long-standing relationship and a deep understanding of the DeFi landscape. Let‚Äôs break down why this investment is noteworthy: Long-term Partnership: Wintermute explicitly stated their support for Euler Finance since its early stages. This investment solidifies a pre-existing partnership, indicating trust and a shared vision for the future of DeFi. Strategic Portfolio Expansion: Adding Euler Finance to their portfolio isn‚Äôt just about increasing the number of projects they back. It‚Äôs about strategically diversifying their investments within the DeFi sector, strengthening their position in this rapidly growing market. Confidence in Euler Finance: Wintermute‚Äôs investment is a strong vote of confidence in Euler Finance‚Äôs technology, team, and potential. It signals to the wider market that Euler Finance is a project with significant promise and staying power. Market Maker Expertise: Wintermute‚Äôs core business is market making, providing liquidity and efficiency to crypto markets. Their involvement with Euler Finance could potentially enhance liquidity and market access for the Euler platform and its users. Understanding Euler Finance: What Makes it Portfolio-Worthy? So, what exactly is Euler Finance, and why has Wintermute Ventures chosen to invest in it? Euler Finance is a permissionless lending protocol on Ethereum that aims to be capital-efficient and feature-rich. Here are some key aspects that make Euler Finance stand out: Permissionless Lending and Borrowing: Euler Finance is permissionless, meaning anyone can list and lend or borrow almost any crypto asset. This open access is crucial for fostering innovation and expanding the DeFi ecosystem. Capital Efficiency: The protocol is designed for capital efficiency, aiming to maximize the utility of deposited assets and optimize borrowing rates. This is vital for attracting liquidity providers and borrowers alike. Feature-Rich Platform: Euler Finance offers a range of features, including isolated lending markets, risk-adjusted borrowing, and customizable risk parameters. These features cater to both sophisticated users and newcomers to DeFi. Focus on Security: In the often-turbulent world of DeFi, security is paramount. Euler Finance places a strong emphasis on security, employing rigorous audits and risk management frameworks to protect user funds. DeFi Investment Strategies: What Can We Learn from Wintermute‚Äôs Move? Wintermute‚Äôs investment in Euler Finance offers valuable insights into current DeFi investment strategies. For those looking to navigate the complex landscape of decentralized finance, here are some key takeaways: Focus on Established Projects with Growth Potential: Wintermute‚Äôs investment in Euler Finance, a project they‚Äôve supported since its early days, highlights the importance of backing projects with a proven track record and clear growth trajectory. Prioritize Strategic Partnerships: The emphasis on the existing partnership between Wintermute and Euler Finance underscores the value of strategic alliances in the crypto space. Investments based on strong relationships can be more resilient and impactful. Look for Projects Solving Real Problems: Euler Finance addresses key challenges in DeFi lending, such as capital efficiency and permissionless access. Investing in projects that offer practical solutions to real-world problems in the crypto ecosystem is a prudent approach. Diversify Your DeFi Portfolio: Wintermute‚Äôs move to expand their strategic portfolio with Euler Finance exemplifies the importance of diversification. Spreading investments across different DeFi protocols can mitigate risk and capture opportunities across various sectors within DeFi. The Role of a Crypto Market Maker in DeFi Growth Crypto market makers like Wintermute play a crucial, often behind-the-scenes, role in the health and growth of the DeFi ecosystem. Their involvement goes beyond just trading; it‚Äôs about building infrastructure and fostering liquidity. Here‚Äôs how market makers contribute to DeFi: Role Description Impact on DeFi Liquidity Provision Market makers provide buy and sell orders on exchanges, ensuring there are always counterparties for trades. Reduces slippage, improves trading efficiency, and makes markets more attractive for users. Price Discovery Market makers contribute to efficient price discovery by continuously quoting prices based on supply and demand. Leads to more accurate and stable asset valuations, crucial for DeFi protocols that rely on price feeds. Market Stability Market makers help to stabilize markets by absorbing large buy or sell orders, preventing extreme price swings. Reduces volatility and builds confidence in the DeFi ecosystem, attracting more participants. Ecosystem Support Market makers often invest in and support promising projects, providing capital and expertise to drive growth. Accelerates innovation and adoption of DeFi by nurturing new projects and protocols. What‚Äôs Next for Wintermute Ventures and Euler Finance? The investment by Wintermute Ventures in Euler Finance is likely just the beginning of a deeper collaboration. We can anticipate several potential developments: Increased Liquidity for Euler Finance: Wintermute‚Äôs market-making expertise could be leveraged to enhance liquidity on the Euler Finance platform, benefiting users with tighter spreads and faster execution. Product Integrations: There could be potential integrations between Wintermute‚Äôs trading infrastructure and Euler Finance‚Äôs lending protocol, creating synergistic opportunities. Further DeFi Innovation: The partnership could foster further innovation in the DeFi space, as both companies combine their strengths to explore new solutions and opportunities. Growth of the DeFi Ecosystem: Ultimately, this kind of strategic investment contributes to the overall growth and maturation of the decentralized finance ecosystem, making it more robust and accessible. Conclusion: A Strategic Move in the DeFi Chess Game Wintermute Ventures‚Äô investment in Euler Finance is more than just a financial transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic move that underscores the growing importance of DeFi in the crypto landscape. It highlights the value of long-term partnerships, the significance of strategic portfolio diversification, and the crucial role of crypto market makers in fostering a healthy and vibrant DeFi ecosystem. As the crypto world continues to evolve, moves like this from Wintermute Ventures offer valuable insights into where the smart money is flowing and what the future of finance might hold. Keep an eye on this space ‚Äì the partnership between Wintermute and Euler Finance is one to watch as DeFi continues its exciting journey. To learn more about the latest DeFi trends, explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi innovation.

title: Safeguarding Wyoming Stablecoin: How Language Tweaks Can Avoid SEC Security Tag
body: In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, states are stepping up to carve their niche. Wyoming, known for its crypto-friendly stance, is now proactively refining the language surrounding its state-backed stablecoin, WYST. Why? To ensure it neatly sidesteps any potential classification as a security by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Let‚Äôs dive into Wyoming‚Äôs strategic move and what it means for the future of state-level digital currencies. Why is Wyoming Fixing its Wyoming Stablecoin Language? The Wyoming Stable Token Commission isn‚Äôt just sitting back; they‚Äôre actively working to preempt any regulatory hurdles. Their goal is clear: to launch the WYST stablecoin, pegged 1:1 to the U.S. dollar, by July 2025. But in the current regulatory landscape, especially with the SEC‚Äôs increased scrutiny over digital assets, proactive measures are crucial. During an April 17th meeting, commissioners openly discussed strategies to minimize crypto security risks. This isn‚Äôt just about compliance; it‚Äôs about ensuring the smooth operation and adoption of WYST. A follow-up memo in May is expected to further detail these strategic language adjustments. This forward-thinking approach is vital because: Clarity is Key: Precise language can be the difference between regulatory green light and red flag. By clarifying the token‚Äôs characteristics, Wyoming aims to ensure WYST is recognized for its intended purpose ‚Äì a stable means of exchange, not an investment security. Avoiding SEC Scrutiny: The SEC‚Äôs classification of a digital asset as a security carries significant regulatory baggage. Wyoming wants to avoid this, ensuring WYST can operate without facing stringent securities regulations that could hinder its utility and adoption. Smooth Launch and Adoption: By addressing potential regulatory concerns upfront, Wyoming is paving the way for a smoother launch and wider acceptance of WYST within and potentially beyond the state. Navigating SEC Guidance : What‚Äôs the Real Concern? The elephant in the room is always the SEC. While clarity on SEC guidance specifically for state-backed stablecoins might still be evolving, the general principles of how the SEC classifies digital assets are well-established. The core concern revolves around the Howey Test, which determines if an asset is an investment contract and thus a security. Key factors the SEC considers include: Investment of Money: Is there an investment of money involved? In the case of stablecoins pegged to fiat, this aspect is nuanced but still relevant. Common Enterprise: Is there a common enterprise where investors pool their money? For WYST, the structure and operation will need to clearly define this aspect. Expectation of Profits: Is there an expectation of profits derived from the efforts of others? This is where Wyoming needs to be particularly careful. Stablecoins are designed for stability, not profit generation in the traditional sense. Wyoming‚Äôs language refinement is likely aimed at ensuring WYST‚Äôs structure and marketing materials clearly emphasize its utility as a stable medium of exchange, rather than an investment vehicle promising profits. This delicate balance is crucial in the eyes of regulators. Stablecoin Regulation Landscape: GENIUS and STABLE Acts on the Horizon Wyoming isn‚Äôt operating in a vacuum. Federal efforts to regulate stablecoins are gaining momentum. The commission is closely monitoring proposed legislation like the GENIUS and STABLE Acts. Understanding these acts provides crucial context to Wyoming‚Äôs proactive stance on stablecoin regulation . Let‚Äôs break down these proposed acts: Act Name Key Focus Potential Impact on WYST GENIUS Act (Guidance, Education, and National Initiatives for Understanding Stablecoins Act) Focuses on research and reporting on stablecoins, mandating studies on their use and risks. Indirect impact. Could shape the broader regulatory understanding of stablecoins, potentially influencing future SEC stances. STABLE Act (Stablecoin Taxonomy Act of 2022) Aims to regulate stablecoin issuers more like banks, requiring them to obtain banking charters and adhere to federal banking regulations. Potentially significant. If passed, WYST might need to comply with federal banking regulations, impacting its operational structure. Wyoming‚Äôs current moves could be seen as preemptive adaptation. These acts, along with other potential federal regulations, underscore the increasing regulatory attention on stablecoins. Wyoming‚Äôs efforts to clarify WYST‚Äôs language are not just about addressing current SEC guidance , but also about future-proofing its stablecoin against potential federal mandates. WYST: Wyoming‚Äôs State-Backed Crypto and Crypto Security Considerations WYST, at its core, represents Wyoming‚Äôs ambition to be a leader in the digital asset space. A state-backed stablecoin could offer several potential benefits: Enhanced Financial Innovation: WYST could foster innovation within Wyoming‚Äôs financial ecosystem, providing a digital dollar alternative for businesses and residents. Reduced Transaction Costs: Utilizing blockchain technology, WYST could potentially offer faster and cheaper transactions compared to traditional payment systems within the state. State Revenue Generation: While not the primary goal, successful implementation and adoption could indirectly benefit Wyoming‚Äôs economy. However, with innovation comes responsibility, especially in crypto security . Ensuring the security and stability of WYST is paramount. This includes: Robust Technology Infrastructure: Building a secure and scalable blockchain infrastructure to support WYST transactions. Transparency and Audits: Regular audits and transparent reporting to maintain public trust and demonstrate the peg to the U.S. dollar is consistently maintained. Compliance with Regulations: Navigating not just SEC concerns, but also broader financial regulations related to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) requirements. Wyoming‚Äôs proactive language adjustments are a testament to their commitment to responsible innovation. By addressing potential regulatory hurdles head-on, they are not just safeguarding WYST, but also setting a precedent for other states exploring state-backed digital currencies. Conclusion: Wyoming‚Äôs Calculated Steps in the Stablecoin Arena Wyoming‚Äôs strategic approach to refining the language around its WYST stablecoin is a masterclass in proactive regulatory engagement. By anticipating potential SEC guidance and closely monitoring federal stablecoin regulation efforts, Wyoming is demonstrating a commitment to responsible innovation in the digital asset space. Their focus on crypto security and clarity is not just about launching a stablecoin; it‚Äôs about building a sustainable and compliant digital financial ecosystem within the state. As Wyoming moves closer to its July 2025 launch target, the crypto world will be watching closely, learning from their carefully calculated steps in navigating the complex regulatory landscape of digital currencies. To learn more about the latest crypto regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping stablecoin regulation and adoption.

title: Bitcoin Exchange Binance Released a New Listing Announcement! Here Are the Altcoins to Be Listed
body: Binance has announced its listing and trading plans for the new digital asset Balance (EPT). Binance Alpha will launch EPT spot trading on April 21, 2025 at 20:00 UTC. Binance Alpha and Binance Futures to List Balance (EPT) Token Then, Binance Futures will open the EPTUSDT perpetual futures contract for trading at 9:00 PM on the same day with a maximum leverage of 20x. Binance has become the first exchange to list EPT on futures and introduce the token on the Alpha platform. As part of this special launch, an airdrop of 3,500 EPT tokens will be organized for Binance Alpha users. Airdrop Details: Users who will benefit from the airdrop will consist of those who purchased EPT through spot or asset accounts in the Binance Alpha region between April 11, 2025 11:00:00 and April 18, 2025 10:59:59. Qualified users will be able to see their airdropped tokens in their Alpha accounts as of 20:10 on April 21, 2025. This development is considered part of Binance's strategy to support new projects and provide early access opportunities to its users. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Bitcoin Exchange Binance Released a New Listing Announcement! Here Are the Altcoins to Be Listed

title: Entertainment Mogul David Geffen Countersues Justin Sun Over Disputed Multimillion-Dollar Sculpture
body: Billionaire media mogul David Geffen has filed a countersuit against crypto entrepreneur Justin Sun, escalating a legal battle over the ownership of a multimillion-dollar sculpture by Alberto Giacometti. The dispute centers on ‚ÄúLe Nez,‚Äù a sculpture Geffen acquired in a 2022 deal valued at approximately $65 million in artwork and cash. Sun, the founder of the Tron blockchain, originally purchased the piece at a Sotheby‚Äôs auction in 2021 for $78 million, with the help of his then-art adviser, Xiong Zihan Sydney. Le Nez. Source: Fondation Giacomett Justin Sun Alleges Trusted Adviser Stole Sculpture Sold to David Geffen Sun‚Äôs February lawsuit alleges that Xiong stole the sculpture and sold it to Geffen without his authorization. But in a 100-page filing on April 16, Geffen fired back, calling the suit a ‚Äúsham‚Äù and accusing Sun of fabricating the claim after being unable to resell the two artworks he received in exchange for the sculpture. Geffen also claims he paid Sun an additional $10.5 million in cash as part of the deal. ‚ÄúSun‚Äôs claims are utterly without merit and represent a bad-faith attempt to interfere with Geffen‚Äôs lawful ownership of the sculpture,‚Äù the countersuit states. Geffen suggests that Sun, under financial strain following a series of crypto market crashes and multimillion-dollar hacks targeting his exchanges Poloniex and HTX, attempted to reclaim the artwork as part of a broader effort to recover losses. The case raises several key disputes, including whether Xiong admitted to theft, inconsistencies in the amount allegedly stolen, and whether Sun is still in possession of the exchanged paintings and funds, which Geffen asserts are being held by dealers. 5/ Sun‚Äôs Empire = Cracking ‚Äì Tron is ultra-centralized, mostly Sun-controlled ‚Äì Poloniex hasn‚Äôt paid users back ‚Äì HTX volume down 60% since 2023 This isn‚Äôt FUD ‚Äî the cracks are already showing. pic.twitter.com/PA92uqlv3B ‚Äî BTC_Chopsticks (@BTC_Chopsticks) April 18, 2025 Geffen‚Äôs filing further alleges a pattern of misconduct by Sun, referencing lawsuits filed by former employees who claimed they were punished for refusing to engage in unethical or illegal business practices. The countersuit paints Sun as someone with a track record of deception and legal manipulation. In response, Sun‚Äôs legal counsel, William Charron, strongly rejected Geffen‚Äôs narrative. ‚ÄúMs. Xiong confessed to the theft, was arrested in China, and is currently in detention,‚Äù Charron told ArtNet . He dismissed Geffen‚Äôs version as ‚Äúextremely misguided‚Äù and maintained that Xiong acted independently of Sun. Justin Sun Once Ate a $6.2M Banana The dispute follows Sun‚Äôs previous art-world headline in November 2023, when he famously ate Maurizio Cattelan‚Äôs ‚ÄúComedian‚Äù ‚Äîa banana duct-taped to a wall‚Äîafter purchasing it for $6.2 million at Sotheby‚Äôs. In another development, Sun has also claimed that First Digital Trust, the entity overseeing FDUSD, was involved in the misappropriation of nearly $500 million. He alleged that First Digital, in partnership with entities such as Dubai-based Aria DMCC, misled FDUSD‚Äôs issuer into wiring funds to an unrelated third party. However, earlier this week, First Digital Labs published a new attestation report confirming that its FDUSD stablecoin remains fully backed by reserves, even as it faces fraud accusations from Tron founder Justin Sun. The post Entertainment Mogul David Geffen Countersues Justin Sun Over Disputed Multimillion-Dollar Sculpture appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: How Will $2.2B Crypto Options Expiry Impact Markets?
body: Around 23,200 Bitcoin options contracts will expire on Friday, April 18, and they have a notional value of roughly $1.9 billion. This week‚Äôs event is smaller than previous weeks , but only marginally. Derivatives and spot crypto trading have been declining as volumes and volatility dried up, so the impact on spot markets is likely to be minimal. Bitcoin Options Expiry This week‚Äôs tranche of Bitcoin options contracts has a put/call ratio of 0.92, meaning that the short and long contract sellers are pretty closely matched. There is also a max pain point of $82,000, which is where most losses will be made on expiry. Moreover, open interest (OI), or the value or number of BTC options contracts yet to expire, is highest at the $100,000 strike price, with around $1.4 billion, indicating a bullish shift in sentiment as derivatives speculators bet on higher prices. However, there is a fair amount of OI at the $75,000 strike price as the bears are maintaining their short positions, according to Deribit. Options Expiry Alert At 08:00 UTC tomorrow, over $2.25B in crypto options are set to expire on Deribit. $BTC : $1.98B notional | Put/Call: 0.92 | Max Pain: $82K $ETH : $271M notional | Put/Call: 0.88 | Max Pain: $1,600 With vol crushed and skew flat, is the market setting‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/df4ha3BPdn ‚Äî Deribit (@DeribitOfficial) April 17, 2025 Crypto derivatives tooling provider Greeks Live said the group ‚Äúappears predominantly bullish‚Äù in the near term, with expectations of BTC moving up to the $88,000 to $90,000 range within the next week despite slower market activity. ‚ÄúSome traders are reinforcing put positions while others note the disconnect between spot buying and futures shorting activity, suggesting market participants remain cautious about potential volatility.‚Äù It observed that futures markets are ‚Äúshowing heavy shorting activity‚Äù while spot keeps buying, which is ‚Äúcreating a potential short squeeze setup.‚Äù In addition to today‚Äôs batch of Bitcoin options, there are around 177,000 Ethereum contracts that are also expiring today, with a notional value of $271 million, a max pain point of $1,600, and a put/call ratio of 0.88. This brings Friday‚Äôs combined crypto options expiry notional value to around $2.2 billion. Crypto Market Outlook Crypto markets have remained relatively stable over the past 24 hours, with total capitalization at $2.72 trillion. Bitcoin dipped below $84,000 but rapidly recovered to reclaim $85,000, where it was trading at the time of writing during the Friday morning Asian session. Ethereum failed to make any progress above $1,600 and has fallen back below this resistance level again, trading at $1,583 at the time of writing. Greeks said that there were opinions that BTC price is ‚Äúholding way too well‚Äù despite low volume, ‚Äúsuggesting potential for upward movement.‚Äù However, analysts agree that consolidation is likely to occur first. The post How Will $2.2B Crypto Options Expiry Impact Markets? appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Manta Network Co-Founder Targeted in Sophisticated Zoom Phishing Attack Using Deepfake Videos
body: Kenny Li, co-founder of Manta Network, has revealed he was the target of a highly advanced phishing attempt involving deepfake technology during a Zoom call. In a detailed post on April 17 , Li described how attackers used prerecorded videos of familiar individuals to impersonate them in what appeared to be a legitimate meeting. Li said the video feed showed recognizable faces with cameras turned on, adding to the illusion of authenticity. No Audio, Fake Update However, he noticed the audio was missing, and the participants prompted him to download a suspicious script file under the guise of a Zoom update. ‚ÄúI could see their legit faces. Everything looked very real. But I couldn‚Äôt hear them‚Ä¶ It asked me to download a script file. I immediately left,‚Äù Li wrote on X. He attempted to confirm the identity of the caller via Telegram, but the person blocked him and deleted all messages shortly after. Li suspects the North Korea-linked Lazarus Group was behind the incident. He also shared screenshots of the Telegram conversation before it was erased. A zoom link that opened to Google Chrome into what looks like a web based Zoom. Then a notification pops up saying your zoom is out of date and you have to download a file to update it. General MO with Lazarus is to find ways to get you to download and open a file so I‚Äôm told. ‚Äî Kenny.manta (@superanonymousk) April 18, 2025 Li warned the crypto community to treat any unexpected download request‚Äîespecially updates or script files‚Äîas a major red flag. ‚ÄúIf you need to download something to continue talking to someone, don‚Äôt do it,‚Äù he emphasized, noting that such attacks exploit emotional familiarity and the fatigue that comes with constant communication in the crypto space. Crypto Users Targeted in Zoom Deepfake Scam Involving Fake Business Client The attack wasn‚Äôt isolated. A member of ContributionDAO reported a similar experience, where the attackers insisted on using a customized Zoom client and refused to switch to Google Meet. ‚ÄúEven though I actually have Zoom on my computer, I couldn‚Äôt use it. They claimed it had to be a business version that they had registered,‚Äù they said. Me too, boss, they also asked me to download Zoom via their link, and said that it's only for their business. Even though I actually have Zoom on my computer, I couldn‚Äôt use it. They claimed it had to be a business version that they had registered. When I requested to switch to‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Vow | ContributionDAO (@VowIMTX) April 18, 2025 Another user, crypto researcher ‚ÄúMeekdonald,‚Äù stated that a friend of theirs had fallen victim to the same ploy. The coordinated nature of the incidents suggests a broader phishing campaign targeting crypto executives using increasingly realistic deepfake methods to spread malware. Last year, a detailed report by blockchain security firm SlowMist revealed that a sophisticated phishing attack disguised as a fake Zoom meeting link has stolen crypto assets worth millions. The scam, first identified on November 14, 2024, targeted users by distributing malicious software through links that mimic the legitimate Zoom interface. In March, Kaito AI, an artificial intelligence-driven platform providing crypto market analysis, and its founder, Yu Hu, were targeted in a social media hack on X . Hackers took control of the account and falsely claimed that Kaito AI‚Äôs wallets had been compromised, warning users that their funds were at risk. The misleading posts, which have since been deleted, aimed to incite panic among investors. The post Manta Network Co-Founder Targeted in Sophisticated Zoom Phishing Attack Using Deepfake Videos appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: What is Bitcoinlib, and how did hackers target it?
body: Bitcoinlib, explained Bitcoinlib is an open-source Python library designed to make Bitcoin development easier. Think of it as a toolbox for programmers who want to create Bitcoin wallets, manage transactions, or build apps that interact with the Bitcoin blockchain . Since its launch, it‚Äôs been downloaded over 1 million times, showing just how widely trusted and used it is in the crypto community. Here‚Äôs what Bitcoinlib does in a nutshell: Creates and manages wallets: It lets developers build Bitcoin wallets to store, send and receive Bitcoin securely. Handles transactions: It simplifies the process of creating, signing and broadcasting Bitcoin transactions. Supports multiple networks: Bitcoinlib works with Bitcoin‚Äôs main network (where real money is involved) and test networks (for experimenting without risk). Open-source and flexible: Being open-source , anyone can use, modify or contribute to its code, making it a go-to for developers worldwide. For beginners, Bitcoinlib is like a user-friendly bridge to Bitcoin‚Äôs complex world. Instead of wrestling with the blockchain‚Äôs technical details, developers can use Bitcoinlib‚Äôs ready-made functions to get things done quickly. For example, this library automates tricky tasks like generating private keys or signing transactions, saving developers hours of coding. Bitcoinlib under fire: How PyPI typosquatting put crypto wallets at risk In early April 2025, security researchers raised alarms about a malicious attack targeting Bitcoinlib users. Hackers didn‚Äôt attack the Bitcoinlib library itself but instead used a sneaky trick to fool developers into downloading fake versions of the library. This attack involved uploading malicious packages to PyPI, the platform where developers download Python libraries like Bitcoinlib. For developers and enthusiasts, tools like Bitcoinlib make it easier to interact with Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain, create wallets , and build applications. But with great power comes great responsibility ‚Äî and unfortunately, great risk. The 2025 Software Supply Chain Security Report by ReversingLabs reveals that software supply chain attacks grew more sophisticated in 2024, with particular intensity around cryptocurrency applications. The report highlights 23 malicious campaigns targeting crypto infrastructure, primarily through open-source repositories like npm and PyPI (Python Package Index). Attackers employed both basic typosquatting and advanced tactics, such as creating legitimate-looking packages that were later updated with malicious code. Examples include the ‚Äúaiocpa‚Äù package, which initially appeared benign but was later weaponized to compromise wallets, and the attack on Solana‚Äôs web3.js library. ReversingLabs calls cryptocurrency a ‚Äúcanary in the coal mine,‚Äù noting that the financial incentives make crypto platforms an attractive target ‚Äî and a preview of future threats to other industries. The report urges organizations to move beyond trust-based assumptions, especially when dealing with third-party or closed-source binaries. Let‚Äôs break down how it happened and why it‚Äôs a big deal. How hackers targeted Bitcoinlib Here‚Äôs a step-by-step look at the attack: Fake packages uploaded to PyPI: Hackers created two fake Python packages called ‚Äúbitcoinlibdbfix‚Äù and ‚Äúbitcoinlib-dev.‚Äù These names were deliberately chosen to sound legitimate, tricking developers into thinking they were updates or fixes for the real Bitcoinlib. Masquerading as solutions: The fake packages were marketed as solutions to a supposed issue with Bitcoinlib that caused error messages during Bitcoin transfers. Developers, eager to fix their code, downloaded these packages without suspecting foul play. Malware embedded in the code: Once installed, the fake packages unleashed wallet-draining malware . This malware replaced a legitimate command-line tool (called clw) with a malicious version. The fake tool was designed to steal sensitive data, such as private keys and wallet addresses, which are the keys to accessing and moving Bitcoin. Stealing crypto assets: With private keys in hand, hackers could access victims‚Äô Bitcoin wallets and transfer funds to their own accounts. Since Bitcoin transactions are irreversible, victims had little chance of recovering their money. Thankfully, security researchers used machine learning to spot the malware. By analyzing patterns in the fake packages, they identified the threat and warned the community, helping to limit the damage. Why does this attack matter? This hack wasn‚Äôt about breaking Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain (which remains secure) but about exploiting human trust. Developers who downloaded the fake packages thought they were getting the real library and ended up with malware that could wipe out their Bitcoin ( BTC ) savings. It‚Äôs a reminder that even trusted platforms like PyPI can be used for scams if you‚Äôre not careful. How typosquatting made the Bitcoinlib attack so effective The Bitcoinlib attack worked because of a tactic called typosquatting . This is when hackers create fake package names that look almost identical to the real ones (like ‚Äúbitcoinlibdbfix‚Äù instead of ‚Äúbitcoinlib‚Äù). Developers, especially those in a rush, might not notice the difference. Here‚Äôs why this trick was so effective: Trust in PyPI: PyPI is the go-to place for Python libraries , so developers assume packages there are safe. Clever naming: The fake packages sounded like official updates, making them seem legitimate. Targeting beginners: New developers, less familiar with spotting scams, were more likely to fall for it. The attack also highlights a broader issue: Open-source platforms rely on community oversight, but they can‚Äôt catch every bad actor. Hackers know this and use it to their advantage. New to crypto? Here‚Äôs what the Bitcoinlib incident teaches about staying safe If you‚Äôre new to crypto, the Bitcoinlib hack might sound scary, but it‚Äôs not a reason to avoid Bitcoin or development tools. Instead, it‚Äôs a chance to learn how to stay safe in a space that‚Äôs full of opportunities ‚Äî and risks. Bitcoinlib is still one of the ways to dip your toes into blockchain development, as long as you take precautions. Here‚Äôs why this matters for you (as a beginner): Crypto is growing: With Bitcoin‚Äôs value soaring and governments exploring digital currencies , learning tools like Bitcoinlib can open doors to exciting careers. Security is key: Understanding scams now will make you a smarter, safer crypto user in the future. Community power: The crypto world thrives on collaboration. By staying informed, you can help protect others from scams. Bitcoinlib is a game-changer for developers who want to explore Bitcoin‚Äôs potential. It‚Äôs easy to use, powerful and backed by a vibrant community. But as the Bitcoinlib attack showed, even the best tools can be targeted by hackers if you‚Äôre not careful. By sticking to trusted sources, double-checking package names and keeping security first, you can use Bitcoinlib to build amazing things without worry. The crypto world is full of surprises ‚Äî some good, others not so good. The Bitcoinlib hack reminds one to stay curious but cautious. Whether you‚Äôre coding your first wallet or just learning about Bitcoin, take it one step at a time, and you‚Äôll be ready to navigate this exciting space like a pro. Have you used Bitcoinlib before, or are you thinking about trying it? During your engagement with Bitcoinlib, if you come across anything suspicious, don‚Äôt stay silent ‚Äî spread the word. In a decentralized world, community awareness is one of the strongest defenses. How to protect yourself from similar crypto hacks If you‚Äôre a developer or crypto user worried about falling for scams like this, don‚Äôt panic. Here are some beginner-friendly tips to stay safe: Double-check package names: Always verify the exact name of the package you‚Äôre downloading. For Bitcoinlib, stick to the official package (just ‚Äúbitcoinlib‚Äù) and avoid anything with extra words like ‚Äúfix‚Äù or ‚Äúdev.‚Äù Use trusted sources: Download libraries only from reputable platforms like PyPI‚Äôs official site, and check user reviews or download counts to gauge trustworthiness. Keep software updated: Regularly update your Python environment and libraries to avoid bugs that hackers could exploit. Use antivirus software: A good antivirus can catch malware before it causes harm, even if you accidentally download a bad package. Store private keys safely: Never store private keys on your computer or in code. Use a hardware wallet (like a Ledger or Trezor ) for extra security. Learn to spot scams: If a package claims to fix an urgent issue or seems too good to be true, take a moment to research it. Google the package name or check crypto forums for warnings. Above all, the lesson is clear for Bitcoinlib users: Stick to the official package and verify everything. For the broader crypto world, this attack underscores the need for better security on open-source platforms.

title: TAO reclaims key support following 13% rally, more gains ahead?
body: TAO rallied as much as 13% on April 18, reclaiming a key support level and pushing its market cap back above $2.2 billion following reports that Nvidia plans to maintain its presence in China despite new U.S. export restrictions. Bittensor ( TAO ) hit an intraday high of $259.2 during Asian trading hours, according to crypto.news, while daily trading volume jumped over 42% to more than $113 million, signaling renewed interest from traders. The gains followed news that Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang visited Beijing this week and met with Chinese trade officials. During the visit, Huang reaffirmed the company‚Äôs commitment to the region, saying Nvidia would ‚Äúspare no effort‚Äù to build compliant products and ‚Äúunswervingly serve the Chinese market.‚Äù This comes after the U.S. blocked exports of Nvidia‚Äôs H20 chip to China, a model designed specifically to comply with earlier export limits. The policy reversal could cost Nvidia a projected $5.5 billion in revenue and has already led to a 7% drop in its stock price as of Wednesday. Following Nvidia‚Äôs confirmation of its continued commitment to China, the broader AI market also reacted positively, rising nearly 4% over the past day. Besides TAO, other top AI coins such as Near Protocol ( NEAR ) recorded a 3.1% gain, while Internet Computer ( ICP ), Render ( RENDER ), FET, and Arweave ( AR ) posted gains between 4% and 9%. These projects often react to Nvidia-related developments , given the chipmaker‚Äôs key role in powering the AI infrastructure many of them rely on. You might also like: Report: Binance held 36% CEX market share in Q1 as total crypto trading volume dropped 12% Analysts say Nvidia‚Äôs ability to adapt will be key to weathering the impact of ongoing trade restrictions. Komodo‚Äôs CTO, Kadan Stadelmann, told crypto.news that Nvidia must work to diversify its supply chains across multiple jurisdictions and maintain strong relationships with global leaders, especially with major industrial powers like China, which is home to 1.4 billion people and a significant portion of Nvidia‚Äôs customer base. ‚ÄúCompanies globally cannot predict what comes tomorrow when it comes to tariffs. For that reason, they are now scrambling to rework once reliable supply chains. While many companies, such as Nvidia, will look to manufacture in the US, they will also look to manufacture in whichever jurisdiction is best suited to create specific products, as well as wherever tariffs do not eat too much profit,‚Äù he added. TAO price analysis Nvidia‚Äôs recent move has clearly been taken as a bullish cue by traders, with TAO‚Äôs open interest surging over 20% in the last 24 hours. According to Santiment data, its weighted social sentiment also turned positive during the same period. On the 1-day TAO/USDT chart, the token has successfully reclaimed the $218 support level, which has been acting as a key support level on multiple occasions in the past. TAO price, MACD and RSI chart ‚Äî April 18 | Source: crypto.news According to market commentator Bitcoinsensus, TAO has formed a double-bottom pattern on the weekly chart, a formation often seen as a trend reversal signal. A confirmed breakout above the pattern‚Äôs neckline could open the path toward a medium-term price target of $1,330, according to the analyst. Looking back at the daily chart, TAO also seems to be breaking out of a multi-month falling wedge setup, another bullish reversal sign. With the pattern nearing convergence, the recent breakout suggests sellers are losing control. If the move holds, it could trigger a sustained uptrend, with momentum already backing the breakout. TAO‚Äôs RSI has climbed above 55, and its MACD lines have formed a bullish crossover. Therefore, the initial target will likely be at $470, which is up by 82% above the current level. Some analysts have set even more ambitious price targets. Per trader , Crypto General TAO could continue $760 as the next major psychological resistance, with a secondary target at $1,340 should strong bullish momentum persist. Read more: Dow drops over 500 points as UnitedHealth tanks, Fed tensions weigh on markets Disclosure: This article does not represent investment advice. The content and materials featured on this page are for educational purposes only.

title: Crypto exchange Kraken to add support for Binance-backed BNB token
body: Binance Coin is set to debut on U.S.-based crypto exchange Kraken with trading pairs including EUR, USD, USDC, and USDT. ‚ÄãBinance Coin ( BNB ) has finally made its way to Kraken as the U.S.-based crypto exchange is planning to list the token. In an X post on Thursday, BNB Chain, the network behind the BNB token, announced that the token go live on Krakein on April 22 at 14:00 UTC, with four trading pairs: BNB/EUR, BNB/USD, BNB/USDC, and BNB/USDT. Deposits for BNB are already open on the platform, the post reads. BNB trading will soon be live on @krakenfx ! You can now deposit $BNB on the exchange‚Äîand that‚Äôs just the beginning. 4 trading pairs are on the way on Apr 22 at 14:00 UTC, opening up new ways to trade & explore the BNB ecosystem: BNB/EUR, BNB/USD, BNB/USDC, BNB/USDT Stay‚Ä¶ ‚Äî BNB Chain (@BNBCHAIN) April 17, 2025 Kraken first included BNB in its listing roadmap back in November 2024. At that time, the exchange stated that inclusion on the roadmap doesn‚Äôt guarantee a listing. You might also like: BNB Chain unveils new $100m liquidity plan for native tokens While it‚Äôs unclear why it took several months to move forward, some believe regulatory pressure may have played a role. Back in late 2022, Lucas Outumuro, head of research at IntoTheBlock, noted in an interview with CoinDesk that crypto exchanges probably ‚Äúdo not list BNB as they see it as a security given the centralization of their network.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs probably not worth U.S. exchanges risking listing a security especially if it‚Äôs a competitor‚Äôs token.‚Äù Lucas Outumuro However, the regulatory landscape in the U.S. changed considerably as with Donald Trump back in office and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission pulling back or halting several enforcement actions against crypto firms, exchanges like Kraken appear more confident in expanding their listings ‚Äî even for tokens of their rivals. Read more: Interview: BNB Chain on hosting Trump-affiliated USD1 stablecoin

title: Manta Network co-founder targeted by Lazarus in Zoom phishing attack
body: Manta Network co-founder Kenny Li narrowly escaped a Zoom phishing attack, suspected to be orchestrated by Lazarus. In his April 17 X post , Kenny Li said that he had been targeted by Lazarus in a Zoom meeting. It started with a known contact asking Li for a chat via Zoom. When Li got on Zoom, the meeting looked legitimate, with the other party having their camera on and their face visible. However, there was no audio on the call, and Li was prompted to download a suspicious script file under the guise of a Zoom update. üö® Just got targeted by Lazarus. A known contact on TG reached out to me to ask for a chat. Scheduled a Zoom call. When I got on the Zoom, it asked me for camera access which I found a bit odd because I have used Zoom many times. Even crazier, the team members had their‚Ä¶ ‚Äî ü§ìKenny.manta (@superanonymousk) April 17, 2025 Suspecting something was off, Li tried to verify the participant‚Äôs identity by suggesting they switch to Google Meet or speak on Telegram. The impersonator refused, then quickly deleted all messages and blocked him. Li later confirmed that the real person whose identity was used in the video call had their accounts compromised by Lazarus. You might also like: Crypto firm CLS Global sanctioned in FBI‚Äôs ‚ÄòToken Mirrors‚Äô sting op This isn‚Äôt the first time Lazarus has used Zoom as a phishing vector. Nick Bax from the Security Alliance highlighted this scam in a March 11 X post . He explained that it usually starts with a few ‚ÄúVCs‚Äù on the call, who claim to have audio issues and claim the victim cannot hear them. If the victim falls for it, they‚Äôre directed to a new Zoom room via a fake link, where they‚Äôre prompted to download a ‚Äúpatch‚Äù to resolve the audio/video problem. Bax noted that this method has been used by threat groups to steal millions of dollars, and other hackers are now replicating these tactics. Having audio issues on your Zoom call? That's not a VC, it's North Korean hackers. Fortunately, this founder realized what was going on. The call starts with a few "VCs" on the call. They send messages in the chat saying they can't hear your audio, or suggesting there's an‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/ZnW8Mtof4F ‚Äî Nick Bax.eth (@bax1337) March 11, 2025 In the thread, several crypto founders shared similar experiences to Kenny Li of Manta Network (MANTA), recounting how they too narrowly avoided falling victim to these Zoom phishing scams. Giulio Xiloyannis, co-founder of the blockchain gaming firm Mon Protocol, recounted an attempted scam where the hacker posed as the project lead from Story Protocol ( IP ) to lure him and his marketing lead into a fake meeting. The deception became clear when he was abruptly asked to join a new Zoom link that faked audio issues in an attempt to get him to download malware. This happened to me and @NFTVai today. The project lead was disguised as a Story Protocol project ( https://t.co/jfQ2VunSmd ) for IP usage and rev sharing (very good fit with @Pixelmon business model and my past investments), at the last minute they asked us to use a ZOOM link and‚Ä¶ https://t.co/SVQHxC1kaU pic.twitter.com/LxINrif6Zk ‚Äî GiulioXüêâ $MON (@GiulioXdotEth) March 12, 2025 David Zhang, co-founder of the stablecoin platform Stably, also faced a similar attack. Initially, the scammers joined his Google Meet call but then fabricated a reason to switch to a different meeting link. Zhang took the call on his tablet, which may have prevented the malware from functioning properly. He suspects the phishing attempt was designed to identify the user‚Äôs operating system and adapt accordingly, but the setup wasn‚Äôt optimized for mobile devices. Melbin Thomas, founder of Devdock AI, also fell victim to the Zoom scam but didn‚Äôt enter his password during the fake installation process. Then, he went offline and did a factory reset. However, he‚Äôs still not sure whether the files are safe, as he transferred them to a hard drive that hasn‚Äôt been reconnected to his system. The same thing happened to me. But didnt give my password while the install was happening. Disconnecte my laptop and I reset to factory settings. But transferred my files to a hard drive. I have not connected the hard drive back to my laptop. Is it still infected? @_SEAL_Org ‚Äî Melbin (melbin.eth) (@melbint04) March 12, 2025 This surge in attacks follows a joint warning from the US, Japan, and South Korea in January about the increasing threat of the Lazarus Group targeting the crypto industry. The Lazarus Group, known for its involvement in high-profile cyber thefts like the Bybit and Ronin network hacks, is suspected to be behind these attacks. You might also like: North Korean IT workers ramp up infiltration of tech and crypto firms across Europe

title: HashKey Capital launches Asia‚Äôs first XRP Tracker Fund
body: HashKey Capital has launched Asia‚Äôs first XRP Tracker Fund, giving professional investors a regulated way to gain exposure to XRP without holding the asset directly. The fund‚Äôs launch, announced in an Apr. 18 press release, marks the latest push to unite traditional finance with digital assets. The XRP Tracker Fund will mirror the price of XRP, the native token of Ripple‚Äôs ( XRP ) payment network. Ripple, an established player in cross-border blockchain transfers, will serve as the anchor investor. The fund offers a simpler and safer way to invest in XRP without having to deal with self-custody, which has become a major concern for institutional players interested in the crypto markets. Vivien Wong, Partner at HashKey Capital, described XRP as ‚Äúone of the most innovative digital assets today,‚Äù adding that the new fund will simplify access to the asset in the region. ‚ÄúXRP stands out as one of the most innovative cryptocurrencies in today‚Äôs market, attracting global enterprises who use it to transact, tokenize, and store value. With the first XRP Tracker Fund available in the region, we simplify access to XRP, catering to the demand for investment opportunities in the very best digital assets.‚Äù ‚Äî Vivien Wong, Partner at HashKey Capital The tracker fund is HashKey‚Äôs third digital asset product, following its Bitcoin ( BTC ) and Ethereum ( ETH ) exchange-traded funds already trading on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. Shares in the XRP fund will be available via monthly subscriptions and redemptions, either through cash or in-kind contributions. It will use pricing data from CF Benchmark, a well-known index provider used in ETF products across the U.S. and Asia-Pacific. You might also like: Ripple, Hidden Road deal exemplifies crypto‚Äôs TradFi takeover: Coin Bureau CEO In addition to the fund, Ripple and HashKey also plan to team up on more projects in the future. The two companies will work together to develop new products in tokenization, decentralized finance, and cross-border payments, including possible projects like a money market fund based on the XRP Ledger, Wong said. The launch comes at a key moment for Ripple. A U.S. court recently approved a joint motion by Ripple and the SEC for a 60-day pause in their appeal proceedings to facilitate settlement discussions. Ripple has also been expanding its services, including integrating RLUSD stablecoin into its network and acquiring trading firm Hidden Road, which handles over $10 billion in daily trading volume. title: GoMining taps industry veterans for new advisory board
body: Bitcoin ( BTC ) mining platform GoMining has formed a new advisory board to reinforce its strategic direction, enhance operational execution, and broaden its market presence, as revealed in an April 17 X post . The GoMining Advisory Board is here! We‚Äôve gathered industry veterans with deep know-how and the leadership to drive real change. @gleb_crypto ‚Äì CEO @blumcrypto , Ex- @binance exec who led Asia expansion. @ChartFuMonkey ‚Äì CEO at Magic Internet Moneyz, NFT and Web3 strategist.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/APNfMmGa1Z ‚Äî GoMining (@GoMining_token) April 17, 2025 Two renowned industry veterans will be part of this new board. The first is Gleb Kostarev, the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and co-founder of cryptocurrency trading app Blum.io. A former senior leader at Binance, Kostarev, oversaw the exchange‚Äôs expansion into Asia and the Commonwealth of Independent States . Coupled with a background in both centralized and decentralized spaces, the executive‚Äôs experience with large-scale growth initiatives is meant to bolster GoMining‚Äôs strategic posture as it endeavors to expand Bitcoin‚Äôs real-world applications. The second industry leader to join the board is Igor Milihram, known also pseudonymously as ‚ÄòChartFuMonkey‚Äô, the CEO of Magic Internet Moneyz. A Web3 veteran since the early days, Milihram was the first hire at Magic Eden ( ME ), where he helped launch hundreds of non-fungible token ( NFT ) projects on the marketplace and was a key player in shaping the platform‚Äôs growth strategy. ChartFuMonkey‚Äôs blend of practical expertise and deep market understanding could be a great boon for GoMining‚Äôs future endeavors. What are GoMining‚Äôs expansion plans? At present, GoMining‚Äôs BTC-centric ecosystem includes 3.5 million registered customers and has sold more than 7.5 Million THs globally. The platform offers access to digital mining and allows users to purchase Terahashes ( TH ) of mining capacity linked directly to its real-world data centers. By doing so, GoMining offers a convenient way for both newcomers and the DeFi -savvy to begin mining ‚Äî positioning it as a key driver of cryptocurrency adoption. Kostarev and Milihram, together with the rest of the GoMining advisory board, will support the expansion of the ecosystem ‚Äî and the long-term vision includes exciting new developments such as debit and virtual cards, a marketplace, as well as expanded functionalities made to expand the utility of every BTC reward gained through the platform. Moreover, there are plans for a BTC-FI-focused launchpad, with the goal of providing early access to a suite of Bitcoin-centric initiatives not just to users who stake on the GOMINING token, but those who own Terahashes as well. Featured image via Shutterstock The post GoMining taps industry veterans for new advisory board appeared first on Finbold .

title: Discover the Ultimate Real-World Asset with Bob Ejodame, VP Capital Markets at INX (Paris Blockchain Week Interview)
body: At this year‚Äôs Paris Blockchain Week, Bob Ejodame, VP of Capital Markets at INX, offered an insightful perspective on the evolving regulatory landscape in the United States, the emergence of real-world assets (RWA), and the broader implications for institutional and retail crypto adoption. A Shift in U.S. Regulation Ejodame began by addressing the notable shift in sentiment which was spurred from the election of President Donald Trump in November 2024. While concrete legislation is yet to be enacted and developed, the language from the White House signals a stance that‚Äôs pro-innovation, especially in comparison to past regulatory hurdles. ‚ÄúYears ago, being a U.S.-based company was a disadvantage in global conversations,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúNow, that stigma is fading fast.‚Äù Despite the early stage of proposed changes, Ejodame noted that optimism is already influencing international sentiment. The concept of a ‚Äúspecial purpose broker-dealer‚Äù and the expansion of custody rights for broker-dealers could unlock new opportunities, particularly for firms already operating under U.S. regulatory frameworks. To this point, CryptoPotato reported on April 11th that Donald Trump signed a bill that repeals the IRS DeFi broker rule, marking a major win for the cryptocurrency industry. RWA: From Hype to Infrastructure Real-world asset (RWA) crypto projects have been a major topic of discussion in recent years, but according to Ejodame, 2024 marked a turning point. Major asset managers like BlackRock and Franklin Templeton began to reveal the depth of their tokenization strategies, many of which had been years in the making. ‚ÄúThe winners last year were money market funds tokenizing treasury assets,‚Äù Ejodame observed. But looking forward, he believes stablecoins are poised to dominate the RWA conversation. While often overlooked in this context, he argues stablecoins are ‚Äúthe ultimate real-world asset‚Äù due to their utility in global financial rails. Another area he highlighted is the tokenization of private credit markets. A new product, a tokenized collateralized loan obligation with secondary trading capabilities, is expected to launch soon. This move could mark a new phase in blockchain adoption within institutional finance. On the retail front, Ejodame emphasized accessibility. Through tokenized equities, individuals in emerging markets can gain fractional exposure to publicly traded companies like Tesla or Google‚Äîan opportunity previously out of reach. The focus, he explained, is on enabling everyday investors in countries like Nigeria, Argentina, or the Philippines to invest in global markets for as little as $10. The Role of INX in a Broader Ecosystem Though the conversation was not promotional in nature, Ejodame briefly addressed INX‚Äôs recent acquisition by Republic. While the deal awaits regulatory approval, it represents a notable moment in the digital asset space. INX, previously a publicly listed company in Canada, had established itself as an end-to-end digital asset service provider‚Äîfrom token issuance to listing and dividend distribution. The acquisition by Republic, a firm known for its crowdfunding footprint in both the U.S. and Europe, opens up new possibilities for integrated, global capital markets infrastructure. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre combining capabilities,‚Äù Ejodame noted, ‚Äúand creating an ecosystem that supports the full lifecycle of a digital asset‚Äîfrom advisory and issuance to trading and distribution.‚Äù Conclusion From regulatory clarity in the U.S. to institutional breakthroughs in private credit, and increased access for retail investors globally, the RWA narrative is no longer theoretical. Bob Ejodame‚Äôs insights offer a confirmation of a rapidly maturing market where real-world assets are becoming central to the next wave of blockchain adoption. The post Discover the Ultimate Real-World Asset with Bob Ejodame, VP Capital Markets at INX (Paris Blockchain Week Interview) appeared first on CryptoPotato .
